batch_info.name: L3_Completion_Final_Expanded
batch_info.description: L3 고급 문법 완성 - 16개 스테이지 확장 (총 800문장)

stages.title: 미래형 심화 (will vs be going to vs 현재진행형)
stages.description: 다양한 미래 표현의 뉘앙스 차이를 이해하고 상황에 맞게 적절히 사용한다.
vocabulary: plan, intend, expect, predict, schedule, decide, promise, announce, forecast, arrange
difficulty_notes: will vs be going to 의도/계획 구분

sentences.en: It's going to rain tomorrow.
I'm going to travel next week.
I will succeed someday.
I'm meeting a friend tonight.
It won't be easy.
I'm going to change the plan.

stages.title: 과거완료 기본 (선행/완료)
stages.description: 과거의 두 시점을 구분하여 먼저 일어난 일을 과거완료로 표현한다.
vocabulary: already, just, never, ever, before, after, until, since, by the time, finished

sentences.kr: 그가 도착했을 때 이미 회의가 끝나 있었습니다.
sentences.en: The meeting had already finished when he arrived.
I had bought tickets before the movie started.

sentences.kr: 그들은 전에 그곳에 가본 적이 없었습니다.
sentences.en: They had never been there before.

sentences.kr: 숙제를 다 했을 때 친구가 전화했어요.
sentences.en: My friend called when I had finished homework.
She said she had already had dinner.
I went out after the rain had stopped.
I had completed everything by 10 o'clock.
Had you read that book before?

sentences.kr: 우리가 도착했을 때 그들은 이미 떠났어요.
sentences.en: They had already left when we arrived.

sentences.kr: 그는 전에 그런 경험을 해본 적이 없었습니다.
sentences.en: He had never experienced that before.
I had given them a gift before they left.

sentences.kr: 영화가 끝났을 때 이미 졸고 있었어요.
sentences.en: I had already fallen asleep when the movie ended.

sentences.kr: 그 소식을 들었을 때 이미 알고 있었습니다.
sentences.en: I had already known when I heard the news.

stages.title: 과거완료진행형 (계속)
stages.description: 과거 특정 시점까지 계속되던 동작이나 상태를 과거완료진행형으로 표현한다.
vocabulary: for, since, how long, until, by the time, still, working, studying, waiting, living

sentences.kr: 그가 올 때까지 2시간 동안 기다리고 있었어요.
sentences.en: I had been waiting for two hours when he came.
They had been living there for ten years.
I had been preparing for an hour before the meeting.
How long had you been studying English?
It had been raining since morning.

sentences.kr: 그녀는 3년 동안 그 회사에서 일하고 있었어요.
sentences.en: She had been working at that company for three years.
We had been meeting until lunch time.

sentences.kr: 그들은 왜 그렇게 오래 기다리고 있었나요?
sentences.en: Why had they been waiting so long?
He had been exercising since morning.

sentences.kr: 우리는 1주일 동안 그 문제를 논의하고 있었습니다.
sentences.en: We had been discussing the issue for a week.
It had been raining since morning as well.
They had been living there for ten years as well.

stages.title: 조건문 심화 (2형/3형)
stages.description: 현재 가정 상황과 과거 가정 상황을 구분하여 적절한 조건문을 사용한다.
vocabulary: if, unless, suppose, imagine, wish, regret, would, could, might, should

sentences.en: If I were rich, I would travel around the world.

sentences.kr: 만약 일찍 출발했다면 지각하지 않았을 거예요.
sentences.en: If I had left early, I wouldn't have been late.

sentences.kr: 시간이 있다면 당신을 도와줄 수 있어요.
sentences.en: If I had time, I could help you.
If I had known that, I would have told you.
If I had studied harder, I would have passed.

sentences.kr: 만약 날씨가 좋다면 피크닉을 갈 텐데요.
sentences.en: If the weather were nice, we would go on a picnic.

sentences.kr: 그 조언을 들었다면 실수하지 않았을 거예요.
sentences.en: If I had listened to the advice, I wouldn't have made mistakes.
What would you do if you were me?

sentences.kr: 만약 그 기회가 있었다면 잡았을 거예요.
sentences.en: If I had had the opportunity, I would have taken it.
If I were younger, I would try again.
If I had time, I would help you.

sentences.kr: 만약 그것을 알았다면 다르게 했을 거예요.
sentences.en: If I had known that, I would have done differently.

sentences.kr: 만약 그 기회가 있었다면 잡았을 거예요. (변형 13)
sentences.en: If I had had the opportunity, I would have taken it as well.
If I had studied harder, I would have passed as well.
If I had studied harder, I would have passed as well.

sentences.kr: 그 조언을 들었다면 실수하지 않았을 거예요. (변형 16)

stages.title: 관계대명사 심화 (that/which/who 정확한 구분)
stages.description: 관계대명사의 제한적/비제한적 용법을 구분하고 쉼표 사용법을 익힌다.
vocabulary: who, which, that, whom, whose, where, when, why, person, thing

sentences.en: The person who I met yesterday was a teacher.

sentences.kr: 그 책은 매우 유명한데, 작년에 출간되었습니다.
sentences.en: The book, which was published last year, is very famous.
Students who learn English study hard.
This is what I was looking for.
Paris, which is my favorite city, is beautiful.
Who is the person that has the car keys?
That's the reason why I said it.

sentences.kr: 그들이 살고 있는 집이 매우 크네요.
sentences.en: The house where they live is very big.
I remember the day when we first met.
We should help people who need help.

sentences.kr: 그 책은 매우 유명한데, 작년에 출간되었습니다. (부정)
sentences.en: The book, which was published last year, isn't very famous.
Thisn't is what I was looking for.
Paris, which isn't my favorite city, is beautiful.

sentences.kr: 그들이 살고 있는 집이 매우 크네요. (부정)
sentences.en: The house where they live isn't very big.
The singer who I like is having a concert.

sentences.kr: 그 영화는 매우 재미있는데, 어제 봤어요.
sentences.en: The movie, which I saw yesterday, was very interesting.
Anyone who needs help should contact us.

vocabulary: plenty of, a bit, a little, quite, rather, fairly, extremely, slightly, considerably, enormous

stages.title: 의견 변경/정정 (On second thought/Actually)
stages.description: 생각의 변화나 정정을 자연스럽고 정중하게 표현한다.
vocabulary: on second thought, actually, come to think of it, wait, correction, change mind, reconsider, realize
difficulty_notes: come to think of it 용법
